meanings.definition: To stimulate the desire for food.
meanings.sent1: The delicious smell of baking cookies can appetise anyone.
meanings.sent2: The sight of a juicy burger can appetise a hungry person.
meanings.sent3: The chef's clever use of spices can appetise even the pickiest eaters.
meanings.sent4: Her description of the dish was so vivid, it could appetise the imagination.
meanings.sent5: The colorful display of fruits at the market appetised the senses.

meanings.sent1: The aroma of freshly baked bread can appetise anyone nearby.
meanings.sent2: Skipping breakfast can appetise you by lunchtime.
meanings.sent3: The movie scenes of a family dinner can appetise the audience.
meanings.sent4: The thought of a warm bowl of soup can appetise the mind on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The sound of sizzling bacon can appetise even the deepest sleeper.

meanings.sent1: The intriguing book cover can appetise readers to explore the story.
meanings.sent2: The upcoming concert announcement can appetise music lovers.
meanings.sent3: The teaser trailer can appetise viewers for the new movie release.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious package on the doorstep appetised curiosity.
meanings.sent5: The first few notes of the song appetised nostalgia for the listeners.
